The game is supposed to be a Gmod murder standalone of some sort, but it fails to deliver that. here are a few flaws i noticed:

>The maps are too open
The killers would not have space to kill someone without being instantly noticed

>No weapon scroll
once your weapon is out, you can't holster it in order to avoid them from finding out

>items unclear
Each items are unclear of what purpose they have (inflatable bat for example, and vorpal blade)

>Skins only for each role
due to this, when someone is wearing a maniac skin (jason voorhes) we can instantly see that he's a killer

>no karma
there should be karma for kill an innocent civilian, like being kicked or drop the weapon

>names unclear
The killer is.... gilbert"
how should we know who gilbert is if the names are too small above each player's head? here's a suggestion
date: if 2 or more people accused on a guy to be the killer
recommended: he should have a cursor on top of his head
hoursPlayed:
so the sherriff knows who to kill.

the civilians should be able to find like

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

PROS
+F2P
+Anime-styled characters/graphics
+Game Concept is Fun; Killer(s) vs Sheriff(s) and Civilians
+Zombies

CONS
-Future PAY 2 PLAY Game.. you will have to BUY with your Real Money Gold Coins" in order to purchase items.
-The Items/Equipment you Buy are Limited.. NOT Permanent! So if you buy the Best Weapon for 300 Gold Coins... you can only use it 3 or 5 rounds.. then it disappears FOREVER.. and you have to BUY another one...
-In-Game Shop really kills this game. And the Gold Coins are only Free now each level up but in the future you can only get them by paying according to the devs.
-Greedy Money Hungry Devs
-Only a few maps to play on.
-Loads of bugs and glitches you will experience.
-Alot of players are unable to play because of LAG
-FATAL ERROR crashes constantly.
-Can't add Friends
-Horrible Anti-Cheat System they've implemented
date:
ppl still cheat/hack frequently
-Chat GUI sucks... can't read the chat in the Lobby at alot of angles... blends in with the wall.
-Can get boring and repetitive quickly after a few games.

OVERALL
recommended: the game concept is fun.. but the PAY 2 PLAY Shop and MONEY HUNGRY DEVS is what will kill this game..\nTry it out if your curious but otherwise just avoid this crap."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a very fun, cartoon styled ,find the killer and survive game.There is a killer,sheriff,and civilian. the sheriff's role is to keep civilians safe and find the killer and is also given a gun that takes 2 shots to the body or one to the head. Civilians spawn with nothing and the main goal is to collect stars and help the sheriff find the killers.Civilians can pick up weapons to help the sheriff. Killers are disguised to look just like everyone else (unless you purchased one of the skins in game then their appearence will change once pulling out weapon) and is armed with a knife or any weapons youve gained through the game (same for sheriff and civilian) and their main goal is to kill all of the players befoe the time goes out (best to go for sheriff first because thats one less shoota with a shoota). Well lets get to the pros and cons

PROS:
~ very easy to run (even with very cheap computers)
~ is alot of fun even though it is in very early access
~ has a great concept to it
~ gives an adrenaline rush when trying to run or fight the killer
~ combat system makes it to where its not too easy for anyone to get the kill (unless you play alot)
~ a very nice community
~ lobbies fill fast
~ much more to come
~ the cartoonish player designs are very fun and not glitchy at all for me
~ easy to level up and get coins for items in shops
~ everything is very easily attainable and no pay to win features (YET)
~ playing with a few friends very much enhances your experience
~ cause alot of paranoia knowing that any one around you can take your life at any given moment

CONS:
~ alot of glitchy areas where people can walk of edge of something and hide in a glitch
~ no actual servers just a random setup so you can be paired with a lobby of russians (not racist just it gets annoying being surrounded by another language so it doesnt help you at all because you cant communicate)
~ frequent crashes
~ things from shop come in packs  EXAMPLE: purchasing a freddy krueger costume can only be used a certain number of times so you haave to keep repurchasing things instead o having a inventory where you can choose what you wanna wear cause i mean we did earn it so we should only have to get it once
~ the mic system bugs out alot so i had to turn off the mic in some games


I totally recommend this game and cant wait to see other improvements and things added
10/10 would get rekt by freddy krueger using a crowbar again

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Crazy Killer is still relatively based on the pretty famous party game by Dmitry Davidoff in 1986, or rather commonly known as the Mafia; Werewolf; Town of Salem. However this game is much more simpler compare to the original gameplay. Crazy Killer consists of the Killer, Sheriff, and the Civilian. The maximum players in a round is 14 players, 2 Killers, 2 Sheriffs, and 10 Civilians. This game doesn't have a day/night phases. Players will be given a non-weapon period from the start, where you can explore and hide your positions or collect stars. Stars will later be converted to silver coins; in-game currency. There's also gold coins to be earned to buy special items from the Shop. At a start everyone will be logged into the Lobby area, where you can purchase weapons, skins, tutorials, and banking. There will be a round countdown timer before it starts, or when there's an ample amount of players that are ready for the next round.

Basically the Killer will have to kill all the Civilians and Sheriffs in the round, in order to win. While the Sheriffs will have to kill the Killer. Civilians will basically be staying alive throughout the round, without being killed. All players have a chance to point to the public which Killer is, while the Killer also have a chance to divert the attention of his role. A fancy box will also be spawned at random areas, should the Killer be not found after Sheriffs have been killed. However the weapon will only last for that particular round only, for one usage. The items go by the per usage round, so there's no items that are permanent usage, probably they might implement them as a cash item. However the weapons shouldn't have an issue, since all weapons does a relative same amount. The guns will have an set amount of ammo though, so it's best to think whom to shoot for the Sheriffs.

The game is build based on the Unreal Engine 4, so you can expect pretty smooth gameplay. However though this is still in the Early Alpha stages of this game, there's no other features, like servers or graphical enhancements, inventory or cash payment system. For networking wise, I'm getting around 300ms ping that's connecting from Singapore. The framerate will be capped at 80 fps, on high settings. There will be times when you leveled up, the leveled up items doesn't show up once you completed the round. You might have to exit to the menu and enter the lobby again. There might some desyncing issues when you try to pinpoint the players whom are the killers, because of the camera view and the cursor movements. In overall this game is worth to be downloaded if you like funny TPS games.

Improvements can be made for example indicating whom is the in-round names matching to whom is the Steam name. Everyone will appear as in-round randomly generated names, but once after the round ends the overview shows everyone's Steam name and their roles. Which I think it might make a confusion to players, as to did Killer killed his mate, or even Sheriffs killing their own mates?

http://crazykiller.com/

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I like the idea but unforntunatly this is a asset filled mess.

Gameplay: It controls poorly with no visual feedback and basic design mistakes, its poorly balanced with basic issues such as overpowered murderers, the weirdly cartoonish graphics and gameplay that don't work with the style of game leading to a broken unfun mess, its focused on mic use with the non mic communication being clunky and unfit for use.
(Worst part right now poorly scripted attempt at a pie menu that glitches and cancles mouse look at random)

Graphics: Clear asset use (which isn't a bad thing) however the models clearly clash and the graphics styles just don't work together.
(Even basic retexturing could have fixed this so I'm not even sure if they even have a modeler.)

Music: Eh. (Not good, not bad, standard game music)

Overall: The rounds are poorly balanced, its controls are sloopy and irrititating, without a whole team of mic users the murderer is almost guareenteed to win, the sound design is bad and gives no feedback, the graphics are laden with mismatching assets that clash and very little seems to have been done to aliviate that problem and the music is generic.

The free GarrysMod mode Murder pulls this idea off much better and frankly very little has been done to make this worth it.

By the way I've worked on unity projects before and frankly being early access is no excuse, I could easily make better assets then whats in this game in a short period of time and I've made better looking and working projects in 3 days even with no formal scripting or formal modeling knowledge.

tl:dr Its just not very good and unless they completly overhaul the game (mainly the controls) and get a modeler I can't see it getting any better.

But i never saw a review about the Microsoft Visual C++ 2015 Runtime program you are suppose to have to play this game...despite the reviews i had to give it a try...not one minute in ...but i was happily greated with the message:
Erorr
the following components are required to run this program
Microsoft visual C++ 2015 runtime


And so i went on microsofts site and tried to download the ''missing'' component.
i tried to download it...and surprize!
the download could not be finished beacuse of an error specifying that i already have the program installed
i went to my computer and looked for the said program. And as said...i already had installed Microsoft Visual C++ 2015 runtime...left hopeless, i uninstalled the game in dissapointment
if your team had fun to play the game...they must be 10 year olds who enjoy cringe.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This review is for early access, so a lot of this stuff will be outdated:


Graphics: The graphics are a fusionfall type style with the outliney cartoonish feel. I kinda like them but they can be a bit weird at times. I give the graphics a 5/10.

Sound: The sound effects sound like they were taken off the internet. They do sound high quality, though. I give the sound an 8/10.

Music: The music is a wacky type that sounds like it has been used in other media before. A 7/10 is in order here.

Controls: The controls are easy to learn, and you would kind of expect that for a game like this. But, when your using a gun as sheriff you can't aim, making it really hard to shoot. I give the controls a 6/10.

Gameplay: The gameplay is extremely fun as it puts you as either sheriff, killer, or civillian. When your a civillian, however, it can get extremely boring. You may have a chance of never finding the killer and having that feel for excitement. As the murder it is really fun. I love stalking people and killing them. As sheriff it is kinda hard, because as I said before, you can't aim, making it really hard to kill. I rate it 8/10.

Conclusion:

The game is ultra fun, I feel like it is a nice spin on the gmod murder gamemode. Although it has it's wonky bits, it IS early access, so I expect more to come. I look forward to the updates. I rate this game a 7/10.

I will be making a video review soon, so stay tuned!

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Pros:
+ Quick: Quick to download, to launch, to matchmake and to play
+ Easy to learn and understand
+ It's a bit like GMod murder

Cons:
- It's a bit like GMod murder but inferior.
- Temporary items is an instant no-no for me, when I pay real money for a nice skin I expect to keep it forever.
- Potentially P2W (To be confirmed once they release said cashshop for the official launch)
- It gets boring and repetitive very fast, there is no point in trying to be clever or discrete like in GMod, since the murderer is faster than the civilians and since you cannot afford to take your time because of the short time limit it is more efficient to simply rush everyone asap.

Final:
Feel free to try it since it's free but keep the content of your wallet for a better game.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Well,maybe its just me and my overly picky self,but this game has a major issue,that being the camera.Its bad,REALLY bad,it angles at just the most inconvinient inclination in any situation,and the controls are finicky at best.The commands to call who the killer is arent exactly thought out well,you have to press a key and then move your mouse to a name,but half the time youll miss because the CAMERA IS AIMED WITH THE MOUSE,this wouldnt matter so much if not for the fact the game is in thirdperson,making it a nightmare to aim at best.So you end up moving the mouse in circles and rapidly clicking,missing the name you want Every time.Although playing the killer is quite fun,its quite hard to aim as the sherrif due to the mouse controlled camera issue.Its good that you can buy items to increase likely hood of being a specific class,its good that its both beta and Free to play otherwise Id feel both dissapointed and scammed,but thats about all good I can come up with,I give it a 5 out of 10.I reccommend playing gmod murder instead,or any murder mini game in most moddable games,there usually better,Id keep my eye out for the full version

Hey guys. RWM03 here.
This game looks really fun to play with friends so me and a couple other mates decided to give it a shot. It kinda reminded us of Town of Salem and we all really enjoy that. Anyways, I managed to get through the Tutorial with 1 crash but once i completed that and got into a Lobby, the game just non-stop crashed. Im gonna keep this game installed since it looks fun and its only in its beta stage and i believe it will turn out to be something truly great. But anyways, game looks great! Keep fixing the bugs and then ill give a positive review.

RWM03 out.

Downloaded it, played it for a good hour, stopped, wanted to play with friends and tried to match up in random games if we could, of course it didn't happen. Played about another hour, then I was forcibly logged out, tried to log back in only to see that my account was banned.

Don't waste your time for a Gmod knockoff that will eventually be p2p. Sure, the graphics are cute, but there's absolutely ZERO support if you get banned for some unknown reason. Would probably play it in it's duration as a f2p game, but I'd rather spend my time elsewhere.
